metadata.title: CVE-2016-2038 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
phpMyAdmin 4.0.x before 4.0.10.13, 4.4.x before 4.4.15.3, and 4.5.x before4.5.4 allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via a craftedrequest, which reveals the full path in an error message.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2038` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.5.4-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.5.4-1').
